item.title: ‘I’ve always been very good with money’: Should I put my wife on the title of our family home, investment property and my late father’s house?
item.description: “If I die and she sells the properties, would she have to pay a lot of capital-gains taxes, especially on the houses we don’t live in?”

item.title: Arm lawsuit against Qualcomm ends in mistrial and favorable ruling for Qualcomm
item.description: Qualcomm did not violate a license with Arm when it acquired Nuvia for $1.4 billion, in a ruling by a jury today.

item.title: Unintended consequences: U.S. election results herald reckless AI development
item.description: AI accelerationists have won as a consequence of the election, potentially sidelining those advocating for a more cautious approach.

item.title: Hugging Face shows how test-time scaling helps small language models punch above their weight
item.description: Given enough time to "think," small language models can beat LLMs at math and coding tasks by generating and verifying multiple answers.

item.title: Perplexity’s Carbon integration will make it easier for enterprises to connect their data to AI search
item.description: With the acquisition of Carbon, Perplexity will expand the knowledge pool powering its AI search engine, making its responses more relevant.

item.title: ‘I just like to have the lights up’: Nicole Kidman admits to big holiday decor no-no
item.description: Kidman confessed to her divisive habit, and has actually “apologized to all the neighbors” for her over-the-top decor.

item.title: The latest victim in a string of break-ins at athletes’ mansions: Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown
item.description: Jaylen Brown has become the latest athlete to be targeted in a string of robberies that have taken place at the homes of high-profile sports stars.

item.title: Wall Street’s ‘Santa Claus rally’ window is about to open with the Dow down in December
item.description: Stocks have struggled ahead of the holidays despite Friday’s rally.
